Posts.Content: hi adriana I had mx and total lymph node removal last march and I found the pain lasted a while, I had painkillers to take the edge off and did the exercises very gently until it started to ease. I would speak to your BCN and not suffer in silence. she can check then that its normal pain and not from an infection or something. I had co codomol and ibuprofen. hope this helps angie xx
Posts.Title: Pain and discomfort

Posts.Content: hi again, just thinking, ask to see if it might be cording. can you feel any twangy bits under your arm, it feels like cord hence the name, but that can be quite painful too. hope youre feeling a bit better angie xx
Posts.Title: Pain and discomfort

Posts.Content: hi yvonne this is the place to be if you want to let off steam. some of your worry might be about your upcoming treatment so if you want to ask any questions we will maybe be able to put your mind at rest. so ask away if anything is bothering you. I would love for my mum to be here too, but she isn't. hope you pick up soon angie xx
Posts.Title: I want my mum n dad

Posts.Content: hi mine was 6 weeks too angie xx
Posts.Title: If you had mastectomy followed by chemo...

Posts.Content: hi i had mx in march and as I left hospital they gave me a bra and softie (foam boob) which has a back opening so that you can alter the size. the foam part on its own would let your breast snuggle inside, but still even your shape up. ask your bcn for a pair of softies, you might even get a bra thrown in. asda do very good post surgery bras too, very good price, pretty and very comfy. angie xx
Posts.Title: Bra Trouble After WLE

Posts.Content: hi i think I have cancer but when I finish rads in September I hope I can say that I had cancer, then I think the tamoxifen can be a preventative medicine. isn't it funny how your mind works?? angie x
Posts.Title: HAD or HAVE?

Posts.Content: hi kat that's a quick appointment, well done !! hope its all ok, its amazing how fast they can be. good luck angie xx
Posts.Title: nervous for my tests on Tuesday. trying too keep busy

Posts.Content: hi kat its important that you don't get fobbed off when you go to the doctors. I had a lump which the doctor said was normal and didn't send me to the clinic. it was breast cancer and I was delayed by 6 months of treatment because I wasn't referred to the clinic when I first found it. so be firm with them and ask to be seen by the breast clinic. its quite possibly nothing to worry about but better to be safe than sorry. good luck, keep us informed. angie xx
Posts.Title: nervous for my tests on Tuesday. trying too keep busy

Posts.Content: hi jackeen definitely tell someone so you can get proper pain relief, even if its just to get a decent sleep. hope you feel ok soon angie xx
Posts.Title: Pain and lack of sleep

Posts.Content: hi i'm new to this site. I know what you mean about the leg shaving! you would think we  could at least have smooth legs as a perk! I did notice as well that my underarms were a little rougher than they have been. i'm on cycle 4, had 3 fec/3 tax, and I think I can feel hair growing back? my head is no longer as smooth, anyone else noticed this? angie x
Posts.Title: Outrageous!

Posts.Content: hi yea I had them too, very good bras. I got some sport bras from the factory shop, also very good, can use pocket for softies/ prosthesis etc really soft. angie xx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy bras

Posts.Content: hi binny so are you having a ct scan or was the examination enough? angie xx
Posts.Title: Need more help girls....

Posts.Content: hi all just to update, rang the pharmacy (which is at my gp surgery) and they are going to order my usual ones, well several actually so I can pick out the ones I normally have ( I can identify the right box). I thought that was really nice. going to get them tomorrow. ive started with headache again today so they said better to have the normal ones than suffer with side effects. angie xx
Posts.Title: tamoxifen different brands

Posts.Content: hi ive just last night started a new brand of tamoxifen and today a dark moody cloud seems to have fell upon me. I had to go and get citalopram which was fine, when I first started taking tamoxifen last September because I could have gone proper nuts. can a new tablet affect you that quick? I know its to do with the different additives but it seems a bit rapid, could it just be coincidence? anyone got any ideas angie x
Posts.Title: tamoxifen different brands

Posts.Content: hi my new one is RelonChem and my old one was wockhardt. my old one was fine, I don't know if it that, it just seems a bit funny the day after I start taking the new one, ive got a cracking headache too. maybe that's just stress?! thanks, angie x
Posts.Title: tamoxifen different brands

Posts.Content: hi when I went to the doctors and got referred she was 'very concerned'. the clinic just said 'that's cancer' and pointed to my lump on the screen. I was on my own because I had sent my oh to the bank! then I was taken straight in to the surgeon who gave me the 'unfortunately ' diagnosis speech. I think they are usually honest from the start. angie xx
Posts.Title: Do docs play down cancer until they get biopsy results or can they...

Posts.Content: hi i'm curious to know if it worked for you, the fresh pineapple, or if it was just a fluke for me. angie xx
Posts.Title: Mouth problems

Posts.Content: hi again just thought i'd mention, my dedicated nurse who looks after me is a macmillan nurse not just a ward nurse, she does know what she's talking about. angie xx
Posts.Title: Mouth problems

Posts.Content: hi fresh pineapple, like the ones in packs at the supermarket, because fresh pineapple has the enzyme that clears it up, juice and tinned does not have this. I tried it and its brill. hope it works for you too. angie xx
Posts.Title: Mouth problems

Posts.Content: hi I had my last chemo today and I asked the nurse, the enzyme in the fresh pineapple dissolves the gunk that sticks in your mouth and on your tongue and removes it. it doesn't exist in tinned or juice because the processing removes it, that's why it has to be a fresh one. also your doctor can prescribe difflam mouthwash which is excellent too for preventing infections. hope this helps angie xx
Posts.Title: Mouth problems

Posts.Content: hi anitaste I started chemo in april, 3 fec and 3 docetaxol after mastectomy and lymph node removal. the fec was fine, it was like a sick bug for a day or so and then after a week I went back to work for two weeks until the next dose, then same again. the docetaxol was harder because it didn't suit me and I had loads of anti sick pills and stuff to make it better, which it did on the 2nd and 3rd. I then had rads and now im on hormone therapy. I wouldn't worry too much because its not as bad as it appears to be once you get used to it and you quickly learn to deal with the side effects. don't get me wrong, its not a piece of cake, I just think sometimes you can worry about things that might not even affect you. at least you can have a good Christmas before it starts. as for the hair loss, I shaved my head 2 weeks after the first fec because I wanted to be in control of it. I had a wig and it wasn't as bad as I thought it would be because I had very short hair to lose instead of long hair. none of its nice, but you can do it! good luck and happy Christmas angie x
Posts.Title: starting treatment

Posts.Content: hi I'm not an expert either but I would say give it a year at least before anything returns to normal, so expect the unexpected. that doesn't sound very helpful does it, but that's how I found it. I year on everything has settled down. angie xx
Posts.Title: Hot flushes?

Posts.Content: hi when I had chemo I had piles and was constipated and also diarrohea at times but I told the doc and she gave me a stronger, more numbing ointment than anusol and it worked great. its called xyloproct, ask for it. as for black stools, I had all kinds of stuff going on so don't worry too much but do mention it to make sure its normal. hope you get sorted out angie xx
Posts.Title: FEC - sorry...question about piles and black stools!!

Posts.Content: hi lizane i'm getting my 5th chemo next week and ive only just stopped working. ive had days off at the cycle each time. I work in a big hotel and lots of people are coming and going but I don't have to be near them, i'm head housekeeper so i'm background. my nurse told me that its people, not things, when it comes to catching a bug or two and the worst for this are kids. I would think hard about exposing yourself to them. The other problem I found is that you will become unreliable, the side effects come and go so randomly that you might not get to work when you need to, therefore unreliable. I don't like being off work, I find in mind numbing, but ive had to give in just now (although I will be sneaking back in a couple of weeks) ive got 12 weeks of treatment left (with rads) and theres no way I can stay at home that long.hope this helps.  angie x
Posts.Title: About to start chemo .a question or two..?...

Posts.Content: hi cathy I had mine in march this year and it feels like its leaked out of your throat and is travelling around your ribs and body, very starnge, but yes its normal I was told. mainly cold drinks. angie xx
Posts.Title: Weird sensations after mastectomy!

Posts.Content: hi I had high blood pressure too. just relax and think about nice things like kids or grandkids or best holidays etc when they take you down. I kept my eyes closed so all the equipment didnt freak me out, its all over before you know it and I have to say the op was the easiest bit for me. hope you don't get too worked up. good luck angie xx
Posts.Title: Op tomorrow

Posts.Content: hi kiera what a lucky girl you are to get rid of that rat from your life. you can now move on, you will be a different person anyway, and the next man that you fall for will be better for you because he will want you for the person that you are now. I know what you mean about how YOU FEEL ABOUT YOURSELF, I had mx, went bald, had chemo and rads, I'm lopsided, I told my OH to go and find someone who was 'normal' a few times. I looked like darth vader when he took his mask off to young skywalker, fat bald head!! old man look !! I felt awful, still do actually, but gradually I'm heading toward recon when I will be rebuilt to something near normal and hopefully that will help my own perception of what I look like to others. your bf would have probably cheated on you anyway, its not because you had a mx, so that's good that he's gone. you now need to slowly have faith in yourself, you don't look disgusting, no one does, you just feel crappy about yourself. You can cope, you are at the start of your new life. hope you realize this soon luvvy. angie xx
Posts.Title: I can't cope anymore

Posts.Content: hi forgot to say - I had a bigger size so as not to rub on the scar. angie xx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy bra - daft question

Posts.Content: hi I think I can remember it being a bit weird smelling when I had mine. the red dye goes through quite quick but I expect the amount of chemicals must make it smell funny, it affects everything doesn't it. keep an eye out for the stinging tho, that might need antibiotics if its cystitis. I used to spray air freshener too, I was a bit nose sensitive. good luck angie xx
Posts.Title: urine smell

Posts.Content: hi I had asda bras, factory shop sports bras are very good although you have to squeeze the cushion into a quite small hole but it does go in ok, and primark have good sports bras that are lovely and soft too. The good thing about the sports bras is that you can 'step into' them rather than having to go over your head, they feel like a crop top.  when you first have your op you might struggle with fastening at the back. I had a front fastener for the first few weeks. hope it all goes well angie xx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy bra - daft question

Posts.Content: hi I remember that happening, trying to get my legs into trousers and the calf muscles not squeezing in anymore. in fact all of me got bigger too. now its just my bottom that wont go in the trousers. oh the joys angie xx
Posts.Title: Leg Calves Increasing in Size After Chemo!

Posts.Content: hi I'm surprised you had a tooth out, they made me wait til I had finished because of the risk of infection. I would ring your onc dept and ask them in case it has to be delayed. angie xx
Posts.Title: chemo therapy

Posts.Content: hi I had a mastectomy 6th march this year. its weird but like anything you get used to it. at 49, I decided it didn't matter what had to be done to make sure the cancer was gone, that was my only aim. at the end of chemo (last one tomorrow), then rads and tmoxifen I expect to get back to normal, recon next  year, even more back to normal, I bet its taken this whole 6 months to be able to put this all in perspective. hope you find a solution that makes you happy, looks can be sorted, the inside bits have to be sorted first though. angie xx
Posts.Title: Just joined and would like some advice

Posts.Content: hi ive had mastectomy followed by chemo rads and 5 years (hoping its going to be 10) hormone therapy. ive had no worries, its manageable, I cant say as I had any choice though, I was given a treatment plan. I do know the chemo has reduced some lumps in other women. I will have reconstruction surgery next year, maybe theyre trying to avoid that by doing a lumpectomy? I would go for the best survival rate whatever it meant having. angie xx
Posts.Title: Any advice Welcome

Posts.Content: hi just wondering, with all the aches and pains from treatment,i finished in September after chemo and rads -  has anyone tried yoga. I wouldn't normally but I have it on my wii fit and ive done a couple of poses that has made me a bit more achey. I think ive stiffened up from the inactivity so I thought I'd give it a go. whats your experiences, or how else do you exercise gently. I do have a very physical job, its the bendy bits that don't really bend anymore - need to sort them out. angie xx
Posts.Title: anyone trying yoga?

Posts.Content: hi anne yes I did feel it on my affected side, that's why I only did a bit. if we had a class in wick or thurso I'm always at work anyway so it looks like a wii fit lady instructor for now! angie xx
Posts.Title: anyone trying yoga?

Posts.Content: hi my first one was bad too, I rang the nurse and told her I was going to die! I had difflam mouthwash, extra painkillers, extra everything really because straight away I informed the oncologist and she made sure I was well equipped for it to not happen a second time. I suggest you let them know when you can, so they can prepare for your second one and they will tell the pharmacy so that you get everything you need, then you wont suffer like this again. I feel for you, I remember it well. its not normal for everybody I don't think, just some of us react a bit more to it than others, I still had the second and third with no problems because I had a carrier bag of preventative drugs too . get well soon hugs angie xx
Posts.Title: Docetaxel - please tell me it gets better??

Posts.Content: hi you will be a bit more tired on the fec but it might make you feel like youre a bit flued up. its not as bad as you expect it will be though. ive had mine and radiotherapy too. you'll be ok. hope all goes well and you get some chemo buddies to help you through it. good luck angie xx
Posts.Title: Startin cHemo next week

Posts.Content: hi studentmidwife I had mastectomy in march and anc (axillary node clearance) of which 8 of around 15 were affected. The tumour was grade 2 and 3. this was quite disturbing at the time but remember that your treatment plan will be tailored to your needs. I had chemo, will have rads and will get hormone therapy for 5 years. I was told by the surgeon the morning after my op that it was 'all clear' - then they had the results from pathology for the lymph nodes - then they decided what to give me. ive got 2 more chemo to go and I've become the 'chemo' person that we all become, its not too bad, sometimes its a bit irritating when you want to get on with normal life. ive had some days of work but i'm still working even now, I wont give in and let it take over completely. Once you get a grip of it you'll be able to put your house in order, then you'll feel better too. good luck with your treatment, angie x
Posts.Title: Diagnosed on Thursday

Posts.Content: hi don't worry about it, just keep posting, we can all help each other regardless of what type or how  it presents itself. welcome angie xx
Posts.Title: Feel like a fraud on this site

Posts.Content: hi I get it too, it feels raw like there's no padding there. its painful, doc told me to take painkillers after she had a poke around. It wakes me up at night too if I roll onto it. angie xx
Posts.Title: Pain in the ribs

Posts.Content: hi all i'm new to this site, just thought I would see whats going on, i'm half way through chemo just gone on docetaxel and decided to stop going to work, so ive got time on my hands. had mx and anc . feeling a bit down today, think its the chemo effect .angie xx
Posts.Title: hi, new to the site

Posts.Content: hi deedee good luck, drink loads - before and after  angie x
Posts.Title: 1st Chemotherapy tomorrow !

Posts.Content: hi nazia if you are that worried I would make an appointment to get examined just to put your mind at rest. I think its quite normal to worry that it might come back, I had same as you last year and I do check really well all over to make sure nothing appears. youre right that theres nothing to compare but you would feel anything big. its important that you are at peace with yourself so if it means an all over check with the nurse or gp, then do it. have you had your 1 year mammogram yet? angie x
Posts.Title: cud it be bk ?

Posts.Content: hi kiera why have they refused diep? im looking at that one, but it wont be until the end of this year because I had rads and chemo last year. angie x
Posts.Title: Deciding whether to have reconstruction or not
